metadata.title: CVE-2022-34485 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers Bryce Seager van Dyk and the Mozilla Fuzzing Teamreported potential vulnerabilities present in Firefox 101. Some of thesebugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enougheffort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 102.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
